quote.about:
Just a guy of nothing. Really.

I'm Jeremy Yonathan, mostly known as my usual nickname Shigeru. Currently majoring in Informatics at Universitas Multimedia Nusantara.
I'm highly passionate in developing and learning about technology. Most commonly in .NET (C#) including Unity and WPF, and web applications using PHP and Node.js.
You may contact me using the links in the footer below. Either to say hi, or just for a random chit-chat!
quote.subquote: *Note that I'm actually hard at communication though. :]

projects.name: Latus
projects.longDescription:
Social media made simple.

This project is made for Web Programming mid-term test project, written in vanilla PHP and Bootstrap. The site itself is an ordinary social network where everyone could register, post, and comment each other.
Mostly worked in login and register backend, including login API.

projects.name: U-School
projects.longDescription:
Simple CRUD project for admin, teachers, and students.

This project is made for Web Programming's laboratory class mid-term test project, written in vanilla PHP and Bootstrap. It is simply a CRUD for admins to add and edit users, teachers to score their students' work, and students to see their results.
Worked in every components, backends, and views.

projects.name: DuarDrincc
projects.longDescription:
Software project as part of Software Project Management class' final project.

Created with Unity, this software is made with designs and requirements made per project's request where the user could order a drink with multiple topping and temperature options.
Mainly worked in coding, with some assistance in some script and components.

projects.name: Knoledge
projects.description: Student CRUD for web programming final project.
projects.longDescription:
School CRUD project for admin, teachers, and students.

This project is made for Web Programming class final project, written using CodeIgniter PHP framework and Semantic UI. Same as my previous mid-term project for the same class, it is a CRUD for admin, teachers, and students for schools.
Mostly worked in backends for login and notifications, and designing the database.

projects.name: MateMatirun
projects.description: A math learning based rhythm game.
projects.longDescription:
A math learning based rhythm game.

This project is made for Game Design and Development class final project, created with Unity. The game lets the player to follow the rhythm while maintaining their rhythm and reaction times.
Mostly worked in mapping logic, design templating, and most backends.

projects.name: Routine
projects.longDescription:
Daily routine wellbeing application.

This project is made for Mobile Programming class final project, made using Android Studio and SDK. It gives the user to add and be reminded of their routines while keeping track of them.
Mostly worked in database programming, preferences, and edit profile intent.

projects.name: World Roller
projects.description: Roll your way through the island!
projects.longDescription:
Roll your way through the island!

This project is made for Game Design and Development 2 class final project, created using Unity. The game plays the concept of tilting the island and rolling the ball to the finish, inspired by Super Monkey Ball games.
Mostly worked in design and scripting.

projects.name: OpenCardMaker
projects.description: ONGEKI save data editor for UnityParrot.
projects.longDescription:
ONGEKI save data editor for UnityParrot generated files.

Developed using Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) based on .NET Framework, this project is created with the motivation to easily read the card's data and inserting them into saved files created with UnityParrot. Also reads all cards available and previews them.

projects.name: This Site!
projects.description: My portofolio website, written using Vue CLI.
projects.longDescription:
Even this site needs credits, right?

This portofolio site has gone over 2 revisions, the first which uses solid green design, while the current revision uses card design language using the same base color, inspired by my friend's portofolio design.
Created using Vue CLI and Tailwind CSS, the second revision emphasizes component-based coding style by myself.
